app.name: RDK2 Hello World
app.description:
This example is an introduction to the basic components of the board: LEDs, Buttons and KitProg3 UART for debug.

For more details, see the README on GitHub.

Rutronik Systems Solutions combine the best products based on their features and performance aiming at creating innovative and best-in-class solutions. Thus, we decisively shorten the time-to-market in dynamic industrial environments. Customers gain the necessary decision-making freedom in the research and pre-development phase and a time advantage over competitors.
app.req_capabilities: adc arduino bsp_gen4 can capsense capsense_linear_slider cat1 cat1a comp csd dma flash_512k hal i2c i2s led low_power lptimer mcu_gp memory memory_qspi multi_core nor_flash pdm pot psoc6 qspi rtc sdhc smart_io spi sram_256k std_crypto switch uart usb_device usb_host udb

app.description:
This code example demonstrates the Android OS AIROC Bluetooth Connect applications custom Bluetooth® Low Energy service Sensor Hub. The accelerometer, barometer, thermometer, and battery voltage data may be monitored using this service. The RAB1-SENSORFUSION demo board and Li-ION single-cell battery are needed additionally for this application to function properly.

For more details, see the README on GitHub.

Rutronik Systems Solutions combine the best products based on their features and performance aiming at creating innovative and best-in-class solutions. Thus, we decisively shorten the time-to-market in dynamic industrial environments. Customers gain the necessary decision-making freedom in the research and pre-development phase and a time advantage over competitors.
app.req_capabilities: adc arduino ble bsp_gen4 capsense cat1 cat1a comp dac dma flash_832k hal i2c led low_power lptimer mcu_gp opamp psoc6 qspi rdk3 rtc secure_boot smart_io spi sram_288k std_crypto switch uart udb

app.name: RDK3 Bluetooth LE Throughput Measurement Client
app.description:
This is a code example for the Bluetooth® Low Energy 5.1 Throughput Measurement GATT client device. Two RDK3 development kits are needed for this demo to function. One functions as a server and the other one as a client device.

For more details, see the README on GitHub.
